block_comment: The Verilog block primarily performs memory resetting and edge tracing for a debugging mechanism. On each positive edge of the clock cycle, if a reset or a certain start condition is detected, it nullifies debugging variables. When a "FAST_CAL" simulation option is active and the calibration state is "CAL1_CALC_IDEL", it iterates through a predefined width to check for different edge conditions and update the corresponding variables. In case these conditions are not met, but calibration state remains "CAL1_CALC_IDEL", it updates the debugging variables if certain edges are detected.
